basics.name: Patrick Kirby
basics.label: Full Stack JavaScript Developer
basics.summary: A life-learner and new technology nerd, I work hard at the things I love: programming and learning.

work.summary: Responsible for all renewal business, hardware and cloud.
highlights: Exceeded quota set by management every quarter without fail
Drove and managed opportunities through both channel and direct sales
Trained channel partners on Lifesize products as well as our sales process
Displayed ability to accurately forecast, track and manage business

work.summary: Responsible for managing and promoting 3 brands within the SHI Channel (D-link, Humanscale, Tech Products 360) at SHI Austin
highlights: Organized and conducted numerous offsite events and huddles where I would present my clients’ solutions and help the reps better understand what they were and how they could start a conversation around them with their customers
Continuously networked within SHI to ensure I stayed in front of as many sales reps as possible
Assisted SHI sales reps by answering any questions they may have and helping them find the solution that would best meet their customer’s needs.

work.summary: Managed large and highly transactional account sets in the Canadian and Tennessee sales territory
highlights: Worked on https://anaconda.org, a packaging and environment manager repository
Contributed to open-source packages such as Bokeh (https://bokeh.pydata.org)
Fast-paced full-stack client-specific projects with modern web development stacks

work.summary: Responsible for discovering, pitching and closing decision makers on our solutions
highlights: Prospected and managed own leads in Salesforce
Worked on multiple projects simultaneously including partnerships with Amazon and Sam’s Club

projects.name: Brewery Finder
projects.description: App built to help people discover local breweries near them
highlights: App designed to help people discover local breweries near them
Built with Node.js, BreweryDB API, and React.js

projects.name: Chuck Norris Joke Genorator
highlights: Uses chucknorris.io to make RESTful API calls
Built with Node.js, BreweryDB API, and React.js
